title: Mount Elder
text:
Mount Elder is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> lying between <a href="Endurance%20Glacier">Endurance Glacier</a> and <a href="Mount%20Pendragon">Mount Pendragon</a> on <a href="Elephant%20Island">Elephant Island</a>, in the <a href="South%20Shetland%20Islands">South Shetland Islands</a> of Antarctica. It was named by the <a href="UK%20Antarctic%20Place-Names%20Committee">UK Antarctic Place-Names Committee</a> for Captain <a href="John%20P.%20Elder">John P. Elder</a>, <a href="Royal%20Engineers">Royal Engineers</a>, surveyor of the U.K. <a href="Joint%20Services%20Expedition%20to%20Elephant%20Island">Joint Services Expedition to Elephant Island</a> in 1970–71.
Important Bird Area.
A tract of ice-free land east of the mountain, extending for 4 km along the shoreline, has been identified as an <a href="Important%20Bird%20Area">Important Bird Area</a> (IBA) by <a href="BirdLife%20International">BirdLife International</a> because it supports a large <a href="bird%20colony">breeding colony</a> of about 14,000 pairs of <a href="chinstrap%20penguin">chinstrap penguin</a>s.
